review_text:
If I was to describe my stay at this house with one word, it would be "Excellence" because this is obviously what Michelle strives for.
The house itself, it's beautiful, it's very clean, it is what you see in the pictures and more. The master bedroom has a big beautiful bathroom that I just loved, all the beds are good quality beds, not the cheap stuff you find at some places. I'm a big guy, over 400Lbs and this is something I tend to have issues with at some AirBnB, they give you cheap furniture that can't really deal with a challenge.
If I was to write this review purely on the house, it's 5 stars easily, big house, clean house, beautiful house, comfortable house, very nice area, big back yard, very quiet area.
And this is my problem, the house alone deserves 5 stars, but then I feel like the experience that Michelle provides deserves another 5 stars. During our stay we had this little joke that if there was anything that we needed, all we had to do was look in the most obvious place and there was probably one already. Need a hair dryer, first drawer by the bathroom sink. Need an iron? Laundry room has one. Coffee maker? Yup there was one. Towels? PLENTY. Soap for the washing machine? There was some. I found things I didn't need, like a baby seat and a baby playpen thing (those were stored in a closet). Basically just know that the house is very well equipped. I didn't see a blender but I didn't look for one either, I'm willing to bet there is probably one in there.
Aside from making sure the house was well equipped with just about everything you could need, Michelle also goes above and beyond to make sure your experience is a good one. It all starts with coming into the house and finding water bottles along with some juices and other drinks in the fridge, water bottles out by the beds also, little chocolates also. A hand written welcome card. My brother in law, Sister and I drove down from Milwaukee Wisconsin. We arrived to the house nearly dead because we were so tired (we don't normally go on such road trips) and getting such a nice welcome was perfect. More importantly the fact that there were some cold drinks to enjoy right away was awesome and the fact that there were some coffee packs that we could use right away was also perfect. You'd be surprised how often I go to stay at AirBnB that don't offer anything, not even water in the fridge, it's horrible when you get there all tired and realize you have to go buy some water right away.
Michelle also has this binder with all kinds of information about the house, rules, nearby restaurants, with her own thoughts on those and it's all just so nicely organized. Obviously I think very highly of how Michelle handles her AirBnB and I think the company should hire her to teach others how to run a good airbnb business.
With all of that said, was everything perfect? No, I did have some issues with the WiFi, I was visiting but during the day I was working on my laptop and I kept getting disconnected. I did talk to Michelle about it and she even came over and called the cable company but she could never even get to talk to an actual person, the automated system was useless. I'm not deducting any points for this however because it's not really something Michelle can control.
I know this is already a long review, and I feel like there is so much more I'd like to say, but I'll just end it reminding you the one word I'd use to describe my stay, Excellence.
